item.title: Getting Statted with Overleaf
item.author: yanboyang713@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: Boyang Yan
item.description: Introduction Overleaf is a collaborative cloud-based LaTeX editor used for writing, editing and publishing scientific documents. Using Git and GitHub Overleaf offers Git-Bridge and GitHub Synchronization features that allow you to link your Overleaf projects with local Git repositories or synchronize them with Git repositories hosted on GitHub. Overleaf Git-Bridge and GitHub Synchronization features allow you to work on your LaTeX source offline, help you to share with collaborators outside of Overleaf, and allow you to integrate Overleaf into more complex workflows.
